page.title: 11The Spectrum
page.content: Spectrum is a magazine that people from this scattered parish buy. It was published because people wanted to keep in touch with each other.It was called Spectrum because Spectrum means a range or variety.Spectrum includes a variety of subjects.Mrs.P.Harrison was the first chairlady in 1969. Mr. M. Bosworth is now the chairman.Each month they publish 28 pages.About 30 people write about what is in Spectrum. The chairman of the committee,Mr. M. Bosworth, thinks it is very important because it is a way for people to keep in touch in this parish.They publish about seven hundred magazines a month and six hundred and sixty people buy it. Spectrum costs fifteen pence.
